definition: at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to handle/to manage/to put in order/to arrange/to administer/to execute/to take action on/to plan

sentences.english: The speed of change is rapid, the statistics bewildering.
sentences.chinese: 变化速度之快，令统计工作手足无措。

sentences.english: Don't you see that he has losen his head?
sentences.chinese: 难道，你没看到他手足无措的样子？

sentences.english: In my fumbled excitement, I misdialed my brother's phone number three times.
sentences.chinese: 由于激动得手足无措，我三次错拨了弟弟的电话号码。

sentences.english: The announcement left investors feeling wronged and wrong-footed.
sentences.chinese: 该声明让投资者觉得憋屈和手足无措。

sentences.english: When RongTian etc, to manage to brother won idea to tell the truth.
sentences.chinese: 当荣田等人手足无措时，至嬴主意向兄长说出真相。

sentences.english: Ifyou start fidgeting with your leg you’ll soon start to feel nervous oranxious.
sentences.chinese: 如果你开始手足无措，你就开始紧张了。

sentences.english: Rampant free enterprise also lives uncomfortably alongside the country’s official ideology.
sentences.chinese: 猖獗的自由企业在国家的官方意识形态下也手足无措。

sentences.english: You got me chasin' rabbits, walkin' on my hands and howlin' at the moon.
sentences.chinese: 是你让我心烦意乱，手足无措，对着月亮长吁短叹。

sentences.english: When confronted with financial storm, are you at a loss?
sentences.chinese: 面对席卷而来的金融风暴，您是否手足无措？

sentences.english: But his first few months in Beijing were a shock.
sentences.chinese: 但是，最初在北京的几月委实让人感到手足无措。
杰克张口结舌，手足无措。

definition: not knowing what to do (idiom); at one's wits' end/embarrassed and at a complete loss
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
panic-stricken (idiom)/to be in a flustered state/also written 張惶失措|张惶失措[zhang1 huang2 shi1 cuo4]
(idiom) to become agitated/to get worked up
